subject: Re: JUnit dynamic testing with file modifications
msgSnippet: ... Here s one of the tests for our GetDate module.  The testData object will have various entries, depending on the object being tested. The testData object
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Thomas L Roche <tlroche@u...> wrote:
> Allen Reinmeyer Dec 28, 2004 3:32 PM
> >> Before development moves along much further, I would like to take
> >> the test harnesses for each object and remove the hardcoding from
> >> them. Each test harness should still be able to be run individually
> >> as it's own test, but I'm looking to the future as well, when we
> >> have the potential to do nightly builds and will want to run all of
> >> the test harnesses as a suite together. This definitely cannot
> >> happen if any hardcoding exists, but there needs to be some
> >> external way to pass each object the information specific to it
> >> only to test. I don't want to create a properties/configuration
> >> file for each object, as many of of the objects can re-use the same
> >> sdf file, logger, and other config files.
>
> Mike Clark Thu Dec 30, 2004 9:49 pm
> > I'd be in a better position to offer advice if I saw example code.
>
> True. Meanwhile: how much data gets passed? Could you just use
> (simple) properties and use, e.g., ant to drive?

Here's one of the tests for our GetDate module. The testData object
will have various entries, depending on the object being tested. The
testData object takes a "key->value" format and some objects will use
the same key name (e.g., "file") and some are unique to only one
object, so I can't necessarily pass one giant testData that has every
possible entry, as some objects will try to use every entry in the
testData object. I had thought about properties, but I guess I'm not
sure how to impliment them on a unit test level as well as then on a
build script. I want the flexibility of being able to run the unit
test individually as well as possibly in a build script as well. I'm
fairly new to all of this, as is the company that I'm working for(java
that is), so I hope I'm making sense as to what I want.

public void testDateTime()
{
String confFileName = "c:\\nas01\\aev2.conf";

AEv2 aev2 = new AEv2(confFileName);
HandyTools.setConfFileName(confFileName);

HashMap testData = new HashMap();

// enter test data here (equivalent of var file entries)
int EXPECTED = 0;
testData.put("format", "mm/dd/yyyy hh:min:ss");

// initialize module
GetDate testClass = new GetDate("", testData);

// perform action
int RESULT = testClass.Execute();

// compare results
Assert.assertTrue( EXPECTED == RESULT );
java.lang.System.out.println("Returned Date/Time: [" +
(String)testData.get("return") + "]");
}
